class_notes:
This course explores art from ancient Egypt focusing on the period from the Predynastic to the end of the Second Intermediate Period (ca. 3000-1550 BCE). Structured roughly chronologically, the course covers the uses and development of ancient Egyptian works of art and architecture within their social, religious, and political contexts as indicated by contemporary sources and traces of practice attested archaeologically. The course includes close engagement with the collection of the Michael C. Carlos Museum to study concrete works from the period.
Art History major/minor: Division I
Museums Concentration core requirement (282 equivalent)
Architectural Studies minor: elective
course_description: An introduction to the art of ancient Egypt from the late Predynastic Period through the Old and Middle Kingdoms to the end of the Second Intermediate Period.
